channel.title: [PI] Question Rep++
channel.description: Mkay, I'm trying to add something like when a person logs on my server for the first time it yells to the server like for example: "[i]Blah Blah has logged in for the first time.[/i]" If you could tell how to do that Rep++ :) - And also, How could i disable following? i thought it would be in FollowPlayer.java but i was wrong :P Again Rep++ if you know.

item.title: [PI] Question Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Make an array like Vain did above, makes it more efficient for the computer to access it, I think. If you optimize everything, it will pay off in the long run.

(Ask Vain).

Read full topic

@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“deans1243, post:39, topic:372352”]Were did you put that? I want it lol:)
I could try to help you disable following, although i have never tried to so i probably wont succeed.[/quote] in PlayerAssistant.java search for public void addStarter() {
then you’ll see something like this public void addStarter() { c.getItems().addItem(995,500000); c.getItems().addItem(554,1000); c.getItems().addItem(555,1000); c.getItems().addItem(556,1000); c.getItems().addItem(558,1500); c.getItems().addItem(1381,1); c.getItems().addItem(1323,1); c.getItems().addItem(841,1); c.getItems().addItem(882,1000); c.getItems().addItem(386,100); }

Just add this under that for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; c2.sendMessage("" + c.playerName + " " + "has logged in for the first time."); } }

item.title: [PI] Question Rep++
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Copy my code, not just part of it.

You have no loop.

Just use this:

public void addStarter() {
    c.showInterface(3559);
    int starter[][] = {{1291, 1} {1171, 1}, {841, 1}, {882, 100}, {380, 100}, {995, 500000}};

    for (int i = 0; i < starter.length(); i++) {
        c.getItems().addItem(starter[i][0], starter[i][1]);
    }

    for (int x = 0; x < Server.playerHandler.players.length; x++) {
        if (Server.playerHandler.players[x] != null) {
            Client all = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[x];
            all.sendMessage(c.playerName + " has just logged in for the first time!");
        }
    }

    c.starter = 1;
}

Does the exact same thing as yours, but less code.[/quote]Well, i still got the errors, does someone wanna do team viewer and see if im doing it wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Question Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

All you had to do was add a “2”.

public void addStarter() {                    
c.showInterface(3559);
c.getItems().addItem(1291, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(1171, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(841, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(882, 100);
c.getItems().addItem(380, 100);
c.getItems().addItem(995, 500000);
c2.sendMessage("A new player has logged onto the server! their username is: " + playerName +"!");
}

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Lol Dean, who’s help topic is this? Get your own!!

I’m sure you can try it and see. When you yell, it sends to everyone right? So simply change “c.sendMessage” with whatever line in yell sends the message to everyone.

Try it first.

Edit: Oh what the hell: try “c2.sendMessage”, if it’s a public method it’ll work, if “c2.sendMessage” is something just inside the yell method, then it won’t.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Question Rep++
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:25, topic:372352”]Just change the sendMessage to your yell method.[/quote] Well im not sure witch part it is :o here is my yell command if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { String rank = ""; String Message = playerCommand.substring(4).toLowerCase(); if (c.playerRights >= 0) { rank = "[Player]"+ c.playerName +":"; if (c.playerRights >= 1) { rank = "@bla@[@blu@Mod@bla@]"+ c.playerName +":"; } if (c.playerRights >= 2) { rank = "@bla@[@red@Admin@bla@]@bla@"+ c.playerName +":"; } if (c.playerRights >= 3) { rank = "@bla@[@red@Owner@bla@]"+ c.playerName +":@bla@"; } if (c.playerRights >= 4) { rank = "[Player]["+ c.playerName +"]:"; } if (c.playerRights >= 10) { rank = "@bla@[@mag@Donator@bla@]"+ c.playerName +":@bla@"; } for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; c2.sendMessage(rank+Message); } } }

And here is what im using atm public void addStarter() { c.showInterface(3559); c.getItems().addItem(1291, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1171, 1); c.getItems().addItem(841, 1); c.getItems().addItem(882, 100); c.getItems().addItem(380, 100); c.getItems().addItem(995, 500000); c.sendMessage("A new player has logged onto the server! their username is: " + playerName +"!"); }
Would you know what i would replace the sendMessage with?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Question Rep++
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

idk what my yell method would be i searched in almost all files in the player folder and i cant find anything. here is a random yell command maybe you can get something out of it? idk…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { if(Connection.isMuted(c)) { return; } for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; switch (c.playerRights){ case 0: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col>"+Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName)+": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5))+""); break; case 1: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=0>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; case 2: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=2>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; case 3: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=2>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; case 4: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=3>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; } } } }
